reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights from 7/1-7/4 as part of our honeymoon. We arrived by train and took a taxi to the hotel, not realizing it is literally right across the street from the train station, about a 3 minute walk. We had a room on the 1st floor with a view of other rooms. The hotel has about 6 or 7 floors, all with long, narrow hallways and long and narrow rooms. The bed and pillows were comfortable, the room has AC and the staff was friendly and helpful. The bathroom was a bit strange since the shower had no threshold separating it from the toilet or sink area, which means that the water goes all over the floor. Even with the shower curtain pulled around you, the water seems to still seep out and wet half the bathroom floor. The breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, sausage, bacon, mini pancakes, toast, croissants, yogurt, cereal, deli meats and cheeses and fruit. There is free Wi-Fi internet access in the room. The hotel is within walking distance to some main attractions such as the red-light district and Anne Frank House, shopping and restaurants, but far away from Vondel Park and some other attractions. Another small issue to note is that the light switches are at the head of the bed, so if you’re sitting up watching TV, you can easily hit the light switches on and off. I would also recommend asking for a room away from the elevator. Our room wasn’t near it, but you could easily hear the TV in those rooms while you’re waiting for the elevator and I’m sure they could hear people talking and the doors opening and closing all night. Our room had a connecting door to the neighboring room and we could hear the TV. Overall it was a decent stay, but we’d probably stay at a more centralized hotel if we find ourselves back in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Modern room, close to train station

likes.disliked: — Small room & shower in the bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bellevue is well positioned near to the main train station, however at nearly £100 per night without breakfast, it was not good value at all. The first night, we were put in a smoking room at the bottom of an internal well and it was dark, noisy and small. They did move us the next day to a lighter, non-smoking room, but it was small still.
reviews.title: Okay, but expensive for what it was

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff were very polite and the room was clean, but I feel that it was a lot of money for such a small, and mediocre room.
reviews.title: Missed the coffee maker

likes.disliked: — Small rooms and no coffee maker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a perfect location, I don't know Amsterdam very well but being so close to the central train station always allowed me to find my way back to the hotel - the rooms are clean and neat, but they are quite small. I enjoyed the access to the outside (Building is three sided with a rooftop walk way on the fourth side to get around to the eleveator) - did miss a coffee maker, none provided. The staff was absolutely delightful and never tired of questions and gave perfect guidance and assistance on every topic. Was only in AMS for one night, and would stay here again!
reviews.title: Buyer Beware!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I travel quite alot and always use trip advisor as our guide to finding a great hotel as other visitors views are a fantastic tool to prepare a good trip and everytime this has been the case. This particular hotel rate's highly amongst fellow 'trip advisors' reviews, so we booked this hotel and confirmed all the details through our agent. On arrival at the hotel we were advised our booking was cancelled, however upon calling our agent 'Ebookers' we were advised the booking was NOT cancelled. Therefore the hotel offered us the sister hotel 'Avenue Hotel' which is supposed to be of 'equal standard', believe me it isn't ( full review posted on the Avenue Hotel) . We believe this hotel the 'Belle Vue' realise it's popularity and double book rooms so to fill up it's sub-standard sister hotel. Buyer beware, you may not be buying a room this hotel when you book.
reviews.title: Great Location, Clean, but look for a deal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: If I were an estate agent I would describe this hotel as a compact, charming hotel with an excellent location. But I'm not an estate agent and thank God I'm only 5 foot nothing!
reviews.title: Small but small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bellevue is all about location. Central Station is across the road so access to trains, trams, buses and taxis is quite literally on your doorstep. You are only a five minute walk to Dam Square and the Red Light district.
reviews.title: Pros & Cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was very straight forward. No big welcome but efficient nonetheless.
reviews.title: Great Location, Wonderful City

likes.liked: — Location, to Central Train Station and Restaurants, night life.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My twin room looked onto Central Station and was basic to say the least. It was tiny. The beds were pushed together, they wouldn't have fit into the room otherwise. There is a small closet and a small desk with one chair in the corner. If you are sitting at the desk you cannot open the door to your room. There is however a safe in the room. The tv is mounted flat onto the wall and there was about 6 inches between the wall and the end of the bed.
reviews.title: Alright hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The bathroom actually had a really nice tub but the wall was angled in such a way that a taller person would have difficulty taking a shower. Quite unbelievably, the was nowhere to store as much as a toothbrush in the bathroom and I had to leave my toiletries in my toilet bag on the side of the bath.
reviews.title: Ideally located

likes.disliked: — Slightly higher price than I would have liked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bellevue Hotel is a small and simple hotel located 2 minutes walk from Amsterdam Centraal train station and the Damrak, possibly the city's busiest street.
reviews.title: Simple, clean hotel in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We booked a double room and were given room 314 on the 3rd floor. It was a very compact wee room but very clean and the furnishings looked quite new. The bathroom/shower room was small but functional and included one of those 'open' showers theyre so fond of on the continent - no actual shower fitting, just a curtain in the corner of the bathroom. But like I said it filled it's purpose very well and the water was always hot
reviews.title: Great Location and value for money

likes.liked: — Great Location, Value for money, Clean and safe

reviews.title: Nice Place
reviews.text: The room also included a small working safe and a wall-mounted flatscreen tv which showed around 20 channels, of which around 6 or 7 were in English including major news channels. We didn'y have breakfast at the hotel as it was 10Euro and there are several places on Damrak offering breakfast and drinks for around 6 Euro, but the dining room was always busy so they must lay on a decent spread.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotels location could not be better. Right at the heart of Amsterdam it is 2 minutes walk from the main train station (which itself is only 20 minutes from Schipol Airport) and 5 minutes from Dam Square where performers and artists were still hard at it even in cold November. The hotel was again only 5 minutes from the red light district and coffee shops, but this whole area is kind of hidden away and if you don't want to be bothered by it you can avoid it easily.
reviews.title: Perfect for tourists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: All-in-all for the price and location the hotel cannot be beat, and I was pleasantly surprised at the standard of the rooms. OK they are small and the halls look like a hostel but I'd definitely reccomend the Bellevue to most.
reviews.title: Diamond for Price and Location

likes.disliked: — Cannot think of anything that was unpleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Having stayed in a bit of a dump last time we went to Amsterdam, I was hoping that this place would be a little better and was pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms are small, which is normal for Amsterdam but fine for a weekend stay. The place is clean and friendly and the breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Bellevue is believably the best budget bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Its right by the station which we found very handy as we stored our bags there on the last day. It also meant that we were walking distance to everything which made getting about so easy.
reviews.title: Great location, tiny rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its on a main road so its not quiet but it wasnt enough noise to disturb us too much.
reviews.title: love this hotel...location...location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a good price on the room which made it really good value for the money and I would re book if we came back providing the room rate was as good.
reviews.title: A bit disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Location is great; once you walk out of the train station, cross the street, turn right on the first street, well the hotel is right there - just 5 minutes' walk!
reviews.title: Adequate for a short stay solo traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel reminds me of those capsule hotels in Japan; well, okay the Bellevue hotel room is indeed larger.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a very modern/contemporary ambience to it and has taken the concept "minimalism" to heart.
reviews.title: Good Location

likes.disliked: — Sleepless nights due to noise and bad bedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Bellevue is great for a very short stay for a solo person who is not, shall we say, blessed with much girth. The room is quite tiny, but it has everything one needs - firm bed, 1 pillow, table & chair, plasma tv, full bathroom and ample storage space.
reviews.title: Just 2 min. to airport train

likes.disliked: — size of room (but small everywhere in Amsterdam)

reviews.title: Small rooms but good hotel in a great location.
reviews.text: Noise reduction was not a priority when they built this hotel, but thankfully most people are out by early morning; there were loud people at night, but a phone call to the front desk took care of it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used this hotel as a one night stop over to spend a day sight seeing in Amsterdam. We walked to the hotel from the station in five minutes and were able to leave our luggage while we went into the city. The reception staff were excellent. The rooms are very small but, as we were on a stop over and spent very little time there it was not an issue. For a longer stay the lack of wardrobe space could have been a problem.
reviews.title: Convenient Stop Over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: Be warned however, the opening times of the bistro are very rigid and several people, us included, were told off by the waiter for coming down to breakfast at the last minute.
reviews.title: White room

likes.disliked: — There wasn't a proper shower unit, just taps a curtain and a drain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first impression of this hotel was very sterile, white and feels like I am staying in the basement of a science lab. There were air vents above the door and majority of the time the room just felt "stuffy". I am not claustrophobic, but the small room combined with white walls and lights made me feel uneasy. It didn't have a cosy feel to what I was use to either. However, the rooms were clean and the location was perfect. I just don't think it is suited to me personally and will not come back here again.
reviews.title: Great location and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two night stay in mid September. Great location! Very clean and fresh. It is located on a busy street near the Central Station but even rooms on the street were quiet. Complimentary breakfast was excellent.. The twin room we had was very small with a larger bathroom. They had a room available for us at 9am when we needed to check-in!!! We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed over a long-weekend recently.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location - Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The comfy beds and the clean modern decor
likes.disliked: — No tea and coffee making facilities but hotels on the continent don't anyway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: stayed here fri and sat night 19th and 20th oct. Location is perfect, just over road from station(3 streets to the right-we took wrong road bcoz of a previous tripadvisor putting apic of mcdonalds labelled view from hotel-nice one). And 2 mins to restauranst 5 mins to red light district perfect.
reviews.title: smart but small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Check in was lengthy due to there being afew couples infront of us and then had to wait for the luggage room key. however the reception staff were extremely polite and spoke extremely good english.
reviews.title: most convenient hotel in amsterdam
Our first disappointment in Amsterdam
reviews.text: We asked for a front facing room but beware the trams do make noise4 early doors if you want this but we only noticed wen we got up for breakfast after an early night. Onto the breakfast - brilliant. Says continental but has boiled and scrambled eggs and bacon. aswell as all the others youd expect and more. colkd meats, breads, cereals, milks. We were very impressed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We paid £96 a night for this which is quite expensive for a 3 star from where we come from, although it mybe does push a 4 star with the decor and cleanslyness. the only downside apart from the 15minute check in was the size of the room. We had a twin pushed together and was barely room for us both to walk round the bed. However the room was faultlessly clean and the bathroom spanking with a great shower.
reviews.title: Well situated contemporary hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall i would def return here and def reccommend to a friend if they could afford the extra money. I had friends who stayed in a hostel and said it was basic but good and clean. That was 15 a night to put it into perspective.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only are you going to the best city in the whole world, if you have booked this hotel then you are going to the very best hotel in the whole of Amsterdam. I have been to the Dam quite a few times now and I have stayed at this hotel twice.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Amsterdam...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very stylish with a fantastic flat screen TV which has quite a few English channels to choose from, there is also a safe in your room which you can use free of charge and the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever had the pleasure of sleeping in. The shower in the Bathroom was fantastic and the whole place is absolutely sparkling clean.
reviews.title: fairly good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Bellevue is located across from Central Station so you dont even have to walk 2 mins to get to your destination, because of this you are also right beside every tram you could possibly need to get to anywhere else in the city.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff are very helpful and on both occassions I have asked for certain requirements and have not been dissapointed on any of my requests - its seems that they go out of their way to make your stay as best as it possibly can be, which is how it should be.
reviews.title: Best location and great breakfast
Convenient Location!
reviews.text: I have come across a few reviews complaining that the rooms are too small but at the end of the day you dont go to Amsterdam to sit around your hotel room all day and I found that there was plenty of room for two in the room and our suitcases sat out the whole time too.
